doc.name: wslogger
doc.synopsis: WSForm extension to write to a MW logbook
doc.description:
A WSForm extension to log information to a MediaWiki Logbook concerning with e.g. actions taken in the form.

note

  • To use this extension for WSForm you will have to have the WSForm user and password configured. Logs are written through the MediaWiki API and we need user rights for this
  • This extension uses a customized version of CustomLogs extensions (available from wikibase)
  • Works with WSForm version 0.8.0.9.6.6 and above
  • On how to create i18n ruiles that are used in a MediaWiki logbook and how to create a MediaWiki Logbook, please read the docs/readme of the CustomLogs extension



note 2

The allowed logtypes written and their accompanied logtags are defined in wslogger.class.php.

Key is logtype, value is logtag

private $allowedTags = [
'log-publiceren'   => 'gepubliceerd',
'log-depubliceren' => 'gedepubliceerd'
];
doc.parameters:
wsform parameter

extension="logging"

hidden field with logging details

hidden field with a name of "wslogger"

wslogger

Needs the following parameters divided by a  ;

user=

logtype=

title=

tag=

option=

summary=
doc.example: <wsfield type="hidden" name="wslogger" value="user=A666bdee-9cd8-48ce-bc74-ce0cf08f3ff1;logtype=publiceren;title=Charlo test;tag=log-publiceren;option= in Handboek AWB" />
doc.note: If one of the required fields is missing. No error message is shown and no log entry is made.
